meanings.definition: To gather or accumulate in a large, disorganized mass.
meanings.sent1: The toys were horded in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: She horded all the colorful stones she found at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels horded so many acorns that they couldn't find them all.
meanings.sent4: The students horded around the teacher, eager to hear the story.
meanings.sent5: The clouds horded together, creating a dark, ominous sky.

meanings.definition: To store away or stockpile for future use.
meanings.sent1: He horded canned food in the basement for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The ants horded sugar in their underground tunnels.
meanings.sent3: She horded so many books that her shelves were overflowing.
meanings.sent4: The old man horded memories of his youth in a dusty box.
meanings.sent5: The bees horded nectar to make sweet honey for the winter.
